context: the patient is a 9-year-old caucasian male with history of recurrent episodes of adenotonsillitis that has been refractory to outpatient antibiotic therapy.

the patient is a 9-year-old caucasian male with history of recurrent episodes of adenotonsillitis that has been refractory to outpatient antibiotic therapy.
estimated blood loss: minimum, less than 5 cc.
specimens: right and left tonsils 2+, adenoid pad 1+.
informed consent was properly obtained from the patient's parents
bovie cautery was used to make an incision on the mucosa of the right anterior tonsillar pillar
suction cautery was then used to adequately obtain hemostasis with the tonsillar fossa
10 mg of decadron was given intraoperatively
the patient tolerated the procedure well and the patient was transported to the recovery room in stable condition
